reviews.text: I stayed in a deluxe room at the Longueville Manor for a week in August.
reviews.title: Sheer Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I absolutely loved the hotel! The staff was friendly, efficient and seemed to speak several different languages.
reviews.title: Be pampered and enjoy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel offers all major UK newspapers, just have your pick and it will be delievered to your room every morning.
reviews.title: We liked it so much we'll be back for our 25th Wedding Anniversary!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very beautiful, and hotel garden (complete with a duck-pond!) is also very nice.
reviews.title: Fantastic - real luxury, decadent but brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is very good and the restaurant really are service-minded and welcoming. Unfortunately, we did not have afternoon tea or lunch at the hotel, but we had a 7 course dinner on our last night. The seven course dinner was paired with matching wines. I really enjoyed the food and wine being presented by the very competent staff. They had two sommeliers working that night, and they were both very happy to answer our questions and discuss wine with us.
reviews.title: well run hotel, very comfortable and very friendly, helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel after reading some of the positive reviews on Tripadvisor, we had been looking for somewhere special while visiting Jersey and just wanted a totally relaxing break without any worries, this hotel did not disappoint.
reviews.title: One of the best hotel experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location just outside St Hilier with great acess to the whole island.
reviews.title: A wonderfully relaxing stay in a first class hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we approached the hotel front door we were made to feel very welcome. The door was opened by a lovely gentleman who greeted us and then introduced us to reception for check in.
reviews.title: Pure excellence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were greeted by name in a very personable manner by reception staff.
reviews.title: You have exceeded Hotel 41

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were then given a tour of the hotel and grounds before being shown our room.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we got married here on friday 14th October 2011..The hotel staff were all second to none with attention to detail first rate. Andrea helped organise things and was very proffesional in every way.The food was excellent and all the waiters/waitresses were"invisible" but there when needed. All in all we had a fantastic day,our room was beautiful and spotlessly clean. would love to revisit in the future....thanks to all at the Manor
reviews.title: wedding

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 days for my partners birthday.Everything other people have said we agree with.The staff are excellent the attention and service are 5 star our room was huge and so was the bathroom they was both spotlessly clean.Breakfast was great lovely buffet lots of fresh fruit and freshly squeezed juice and cooked also available if you want it.We also had a dinner on my partners birthday which was really nice and we got a plate with happy birthday piped on it with an array of chocolates!(they were yummy!). we would throughly reccomend it.
reviews.title: Great Stay for Birthday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011
reviews.text: Nothing was too much trouble for the staff at Longueville Manor. The breakfasts were magnificent and we thoroughly enjoyed our dinner in the restaurant where the kitchen was more than happy to accommodate my pregnancy-friendly requests. The thermostat on the shower was broken and they immediately sent someone to fix it and offered to move us to an alternative room. I particularly enjoyed the morning tea and coffee service. Negatives would be the size of the room and the waitress' knowledge of the cheeseboard. Fairly minor criticisms!!
reviews.title: Pure luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just stayed for one week at this hotel and it was a totally brilliant experience. The staff without exception provided the highest level of service and were all personable, friendly, knowledgable and helpful. The restaurant consistently provided a very high standard of cuisine, (the cheese souffles were to die for) easily outstripping the only Michelin starred restaurant on the island for quality, ambiance and value.
reviews.title: Top quality hotel & restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel rooms, the terrace with wonderful large outdoor heated swimming pool, gardens and grounds were all delightful and the staff, lead by their very accesible Managing Director, were outstanding.
reviews.title: Heavan on Earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a late trip to Jersey in order to have a 'babymoon' (a last trip away before the baby arrives for those not aware of this fantastic excuse for a holiday!). We couldn't have picked a better location, or hotel. From the moment we were met in the car park and had our bags taken in, we knew we were going to be well looked after. We have been lucky enough to stay in quite a lot of hotels around the world, though admittedly none have been 5*. However, the service element is clearly where the difference is made. We were very well looked after throughout our stay - from upgrading our room (thank you!), to the delicious breakfast feast we indulged ourselves in each morning. Our room was spacious, really comfortable, and very grand. It was one of those places where we knew we didn't belong, but wasn't at all pretentious so as to make us feel that we didn't belong!
reviews.title: Luxurious & friendly, a perfect and romantic getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jersey was a great destination for pottering around and there was enough to see and do in the 4 nights we spent there. The mild November weather really helped too, as did having a hire car.
reviews.title: Superb old world elegance!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'd love to say that we will be returning very soon, but that might not be for at least the next 18 years unless we get some kind offers from babysitters!
reviews.title: Obviously 5 star but spoilt by Complacency

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I chose this hotel for a short break to celebrate my "significant" birthday in October having read the reports on Tripadvisor. We had not been to Jersey for many years and thought it would make a change from our usual destinations in southern Europe. I must say it is the finest hotel we have stayed in; true 5 star quality.
reviews.title: Absolutely Incredible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We had booked a standard room and were surprised and delighted to be informed on arrival that we had been up graded to a suite. This was the Longueville Suite and it was truly magnificent, sheer quality! There was champagne waiting for us and the largest, tallest, most comfortable four poster bed we had ever seen, incredible! The bathroom was amazing, it even had a small TV built into the wall and a waterproof remote control. The shower was without doubt the best we have ever used.
reviews.title: One to do again

description: Longueville Manor is the Channel Island’s most highly acclaimed hotel and the only member of the exclusive Relais & Châteaux luxury hotel collection. A stunningly refurbished Jersey manor house with 30 beautifully appointed bedrooms and suites, this boutique property is one of Europe’s most celebrated getaway destinations.Guests are offered the warmest of welcomes, a home from home atmosphere from arrival to departure, and superior yet understated service. With an impressive attention to detail and fine food and wine served in either formal or casual surroundings, the hotel is a haven of luxury and indulgence.
